reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent, well-designed GPS, large screen.
reviews.reviewText: Excellent device, clean and very well-designed, modern, simple interface. More intuitive and easy to use menus than Garmin. I like the large screen (less map scrolling needed) and you can customize part of the menu to select which items and what order they appear in. From sleep, starts up fast and locates satellite very fast. The included micro USB cord fits more snugly (a good thing) compared to a generic micro USB wire. Also fits more snugly than Garmin GPS unit I had.The included suction cup is low profile and works well and easy to attach. Make sure glass is clean. Just give it a quarter turn and it's locked. You can remove (or invert) the suction bracket it if you wanted to use this device in your own cellphone holder. If you don't like it on the windshield, a cellphone bracket designed for a cupholder or cd mount would be a good option as long as it was big enough.Bluetooth pairing it to a cell phone (free app) enables traffic and quickfix satellite updates (used to locate the satellites more quickly after startup). When you first get it, you'll want to install the PC software to get the latest map and you can use the pc software to get the quickfix updates.Yes, I still like my cell phone but it's nice to have a device that always works regardless of cell tower locations in rural locations and is dedicated to one purpose, particularly for road trips and going out of town. You can use a phone to navigate where there is good cell coverage but you are switching apps on your phone to do other tasks which is a hassle and a distraction. I didn't think I needed a separate GPS any more until I took a trip and realized that once you are away from major cities, or in the mountains, phone based navigation is hit or miss and you can be in the middle of nowhere with minimal map support on a phone and then you are compromising your safety. Even if you don't use it every day, it's good to have in your car. Seller delivered promptly and device was in perfect condition.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars This is a product from tech hell.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this model thinking my aging eyes would like the larger screen. Yes, the screen is good if you zoom it in. I have owned 3 TomTom gps over the last decade. I liked their easy to use interface. On this model there is nothing that resembles any of the of older interface. You can reach a menu that includes home and gas station buttons. On my older gps's there were also hotel, restaurant, and many other easily accessible points of interest. On this model you have to type the word hotel or restaurant on the keyboard and then hope to direct it to the city of your interest. There is voice activation of some features, but not any that I commonly use (e.g., hotel, restaurant). There are enormously complicated instructions to link it to your cell phone with Bluetooth. With this link up you get a 3 month trial that shows traffic congestion, red light cameras, speed cameras, etc. After the 3 months there is a subscription. I live in a relatively small town in Iowa and don't need any of those features. If you can chug your way through the 110 pg instruction manual and get usable gps info from this thing, you are a better person than I am. It is just too complicated except maybe for a techno-weanie.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Goo GPS, easy to read.
reviews.reviewText: I had this model, then TSA dropped it and severely broke the screen. I ordered this one, and now I'm back to work checking tower sites out in the field. About the only bad thing I have to say about the product is that I really wish I could have pulled the SD card out of the old one and placed it into this one to have all my bookmarks. At the very least... it would have been nice to be able to download and upload them.If you travel a lot and save favorites... write them down... apparently none of these GPS manufacturers have figured out that we may want to archive our data and upload into future devices. :- (

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Mostly like it. Starts up & picks up satellites quickly
reviews.reviewText: Mostly like it. Starts up & picks up satellites quickly. Not in love with the new menu - the old menu was better - thus only 4 stars. I like the screen and the bigger size of the 60 S. Thus far is has been a good GPS for my travels. At about $70 refurbished, I am pretty pleased.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars great unit and seller
reviews.reviewText: great unit and seller. i used it to navigate from NC to Washington DC... going there was great but getting back was difficult as it kept trying to take me on a freeway exit the didn't exist. I had to use my phone to navigate around it. so far that has been my only issue to date.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well worth the money
reviews.reviewText: After reading some reviews stating that this was not the "S" model, I would like to confirm that mine was indeed an "S" model.Overall, the unit is a massive upgrade over my old Start 50. Not only does it turn on automatically with my car, but after changing the settings, it turns off with it too. It connects effortlessly with my iPhone and shows traffic conditions like Google Maps. So far this has been an excellent product and I am glad i made the purchase. Well worth the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars This model is not as useful and efficient as my old TomTom 1605
reviews.reviewText: This model is not as useful and efficient as my old TomTom 1605. It's bulky and awkward. The screen doesn't rotate and you have to remove the attached arm, rotate the unit, and re-attach the arm if you want to use it on the dashboard (versus on the windshield). Software functions is subpar compared to 1605. Instead of displaying 9 icons on the menu it only displays 5 so you have to scroll one-at-a-time. Lastly, it gives you a bunch of languages but neglect to address choices such Chinese and voices with good tones in English.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars After the first couple uses it became quite easy to use
reviews.reviewText: At first it took a little getting used to as it was not the way we were use to inputting our data. After the first couple uses it became quite easy to use. picks up the satellites quickly, has Bluetooth input from your phone, traffic alerts and lifetime updates. We have two older tom toms and there was a bit of a learning curve before adjusting to the new input steps.

reviews.reviewTitle: I needed this item for travels.
reviews.reviewText: I am happy with this item. It came to my door in a quick and efficient manner. Thank you Amazon.

The media could not be loaded. It dead on me in second days of use , The screen went black and shut down and then never able to reboot it ,I try holding the on/off button for 30 sec, try to connect to my PC won't work because I can't turn it on . see videoreturning it today ,
